channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Area by bike bay is a state, 13th December
item.description:
The are around the Lime bike bays at the junction of Hansler Road and Lordship Lane is even worse than usual. Litter/fly tipping, 3 x abandoned green wheelie bins which seem to be a health hazard please leaves everywhere. It looks dreadful and is dangerous. Please sort it out. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 133, Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed Vehicle has been abandoned, 13th December
item.description:
Untaxed Vauxhall Insignia has been abandoned here for months. Windows wide open.

item.title: CATV manhole cover sinking and broken pavement slabs, 13th December
item.description:
This CATV manhole cover was mended in August 2025 with sand - it is now sinking and is wobbly. It has been like this for a month, and is getting worse. Other covers on the same road are surrounded by concrete, instead of sand. Also, the pavement slabs around this cover are broken.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tewson Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water on the road kerbside not dispersing into drains, 13th December
item.description:
The water is coming from the Jet petrol station chipperfield road BR5 2QR it has recently had the forecourt refurbished and two Jet washers have been resited. The fall of the forecourt is incorrect and when the jet washers are in use the excess waste water misses the forecourt gutter and flows onto the pavement and Chipperfield road. The water sits and stagnates and begins to smell. if the water sitting on the pavements would freeze it would be a hazard. I have informed the garage and no action has been taken. I noticed a previous complaint was raised and closed ffor this , siting a blocked sewage drain , i do not believe this to be the case,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
